title: How Russia is feeding another dictatorship thousands of miles away
description: I am thinking of a man who sang of freedom. His name is Zeyar Thaw.

title: Images show Chinese SWAT officers hovering over unaccompanied women following assaults
description: Chinese police are making a public show of force to crack down on crime following outrage over video showing women being assaulted in public.  CNN's Selina Wang reports.

title: How Russia is wearing down Ukrainian forces in the Donbas
description: Ukrainian fighters in the Donbas region find themselves slowly being worn down by constant battering at the hands of Russian military forces.  CNN's Phil Black reports how Russia is putting the squeeze on key areas in this important region of Ukraine.

title: James Corden works at the White House for a day
description: During an episode of "The Late Late Show," host James Corden went to the White House and worked a variety of jobs, including personal assistant to President Joe Biden and Press Secretary.

title: How new anti-LGBTQ laws echo an infamous conservative activist's campaign from 1977
description: What critics have dubbed the "Don't Say Gay" bill, signed by Florida governor Ron DeSantis, is reminiscent of the opposition to LGBTQ rights seen in the 1970s. Reality Check's John Avlon speaks with activist and Oscar-winning screenwriter of Milk, Dustin Lance Black, about how the law could hurt some of the kids it says it wants to help.

title: New US bank operates 100% in Spanish
description: Seis is a new bank built 100% in Spanish that aims to make banking easier for Spanish speakers and more accessible for immigrants who don't have a social security number.

title: Symbol of Ukrainian resistance at center of new dispute
description: Snake Island, a symbol of Ukrainian resistance, is back in the headlines as both Ukraine and Russia make different claims on why Russian troops withdrew from the island. CNN's Scott McLean reports.

title: Carnivorous plant that traps prey underground is the first of its kind to be discovered
description: Scientists have discovered a carnivorous plant that grows prey-trapping contraptions underground, feeding off subterranean creatures such as worms, larvae and beetles.

title: A boat crashed in front of an officer in Louisiana. Hear what happened next
description: CNN's Omar Jimenez speaks with Louisiana Department of Wildlife and Fisheries Sgt. Stephen Rhodes, who went beyond the call of duty to save a little girl and her father after a boat accident.

title: 'We are in extreme crisis': Italian parmesan producers fear for future
description: The main artery that cuts through Italy's heartland, where 30% of its food is produced, is the 650-kilometer-long (400-mile-long) River Po, which winds its way from the Alps to the Adriatic Sea on Italy's northeast coast.

title: Prince Charles' 'emotional' first meeting with granddaughter Lilibet
description: We didn't get to see much of the Sussexes when they returned to the UK last month. But we're hearing they were able to spend some quality time with members of the royal family, away from prying eyes.

title: This man and his dog spent seven years walking around the world
description: Very few people attempt to walk around the entire world, and even fewer actually manage to complete the journey.

title: 'There's nothing to celebrate': Hong Kong citizens uninterested in President Xi's visit
Casting of Rodin's 'Thinker' fetches $11.1 Million at Paris auction
description: A casting of Auguste Rodin's "The Thinker" sculpture, one of the most iconic works of art in the world, sold for 10.7 million euros ($11.14 million) at a Paris auction on Thursday.
